name: African Cabbage Stew
author: MissGhana85
summary: A flavorful stew with tomatoes and cabbage. Very versatile. Serve with boiled yams, plantains, potatoes, rice, or any other starch on the side. Sardines in tomato sauce can stand in for the mackerel.
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can mackerel in tomato sauce
1 pinch red pepper flakes, or to taste
1 pinch seasoned salt, or to taste
directions: Place cabbage into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until just tender, about 10 minutes
Heat canola oil in a saucepan over medium heat
Cook and stir onion and garlic in hot oil until onion is translucent, 5 to 7 minutes
Stir tomatoes into onion mixture, place cover on saucepan, and cook until tomatoes are soft, 10 to 15 minutes
Mix water and tomato paste in a small bowl until smooth; pour into the saucepan
Stir the mixture, replace the cover, and cook another 5 minutes
Add mackerel in tomato sauce; season with red pepper flakes and seasoned salt
Stir drained cabbage into the mixture
Cover saucepan and simmer mixture until mackerel is hot, 10 to 15 minutes
